newsitem.title: USA: Democrat has big lead in Washington governor's race.
newsitem.headline: Democrat has big lead in Washington governor's race.

text.p: In the race to succeed outgoing Washington Gov. Mike Lowry, Democrat Gary Locke has a wide lead over Republican Ellen Craswell, according to poll results published on Tuesday.

With two weeks before the Nov. 5 election, Locke, the top elected official in the state's biggest county, was favoured by 52 percent of likely voters, according to two opinion polls published in the Seattle Post-Intelligencer newspaper.
Craswell, a former state senator, was supported by 37 percent of those questioned by Evans/McDonough Inc., which generally does polling for Democrats, and by 26 percent in the independent Elway poll.
Both polls also said President Bill Clinton was far ahead of Republican challenger Bob Dole with support from 47 percent of likely voters.
The Elway poll said Dole was favoured by just 28 percent, while the Evans/McDonough poll said the former Senate majority leader had backing from 38 percent of those questioned.
Third party candidate Ross Perot was seen getting six percent of the vote in both polls, with the remainder going to consumer activist Ralph Nader or undecided.

The Elway poll surveyed 400 likely voters and had a margin of error of five percentage points. The Evans/McDonough poll questioned 600 likely voters and had a margin of error of four percentage points.

In the Elway Poll, Craswell won overwhelming support from voters who identified themselves as Republicans and from Christian conservatives. Craswell, who emerged a narrow winner in an eight-way primary last month, is from the party's Christian conservative wing and has pledged she would return state government to Biblical values.

Locke, a former state legislator who is now executive of King County, which includes Seattle, has promoted a moderate platform after the more liberal Democrat Lowry, who is stepping down after one term.
If elected, Locke, the son of Chinese immigrants, would be the first Asian-American U.S. state governor outside Hawaii.
